result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Michael Favata Jr.

records.addlTxt: 11:35am Cases called: 22CF1040 and 22CF1041. Defendant Thomas Michael Favata Jr. not in court, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Erika Amundson appeared via video conference from the jail. Attorney Robert Stoiber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Clarification to the bond made on the record. Bond remains unchanged and continues.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Dated 09/13/2022, Letter from ADA Piltz to Court regarding court record correction to reflect defendant's appearances.

(Cases 22CF1040, 22CF1041 are called at 11:06 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Thomas Favata Jr. appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. ADA Trenton Piltz appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaints in 22CF1040, 22CF1041. State requests $500 cash bond to cover both cases. Defense requests signature bond. Court orders $500 cash bond to cover both cases with various conditions. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived.  
Hearing: 10/19/2022 at 10:00 AM (Branch 4).

Conditions:
No contact with the Lismore, Sojourner's House. 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services. 
(Covers 22CF1040, 22CF1041)
